item.title: GNU Autotest
item.description: GNU Autotest is a test framework that, together with supporting scripts and unit test files, can unit test an application. Autotest is part of the Autotools library, a.k.a. the GNU Build System. The Autotest scripts execute unit tests by making shell-like calls to utilities, Python scripts and C unit test applications, and comparing their return values (exit code, stdout and stderr) to predefined values. To do this, Autotest defines a number of M4 macros, such as AT_INIT and AT_CLEANUP.
